Review Text: A great pub/establishment. It has a lovely cafe area and a great bar also. The cafe is relatively cheap and give a great offer on brews, with a cup of tea, coffee or hot chocolate for ¬£1.50 with unlimited refill which is great if you have lots of work to catch up on and like a nice relaxed atmosphere to do it in. The nightlife is also great, since I've been a teenager this place has had a lovely crowd of people with great music and sports for the fanatics...
Recommended Dishes: Veggie Breakfast, Fish and Chips, Noodles, Lamb Shank, Traditional Breakfast, Eggs Benedict, Lasagna, Pizza, Six Onion Rings, Toast, Caramel Cookie Dough, Empire Burger, 3 Small Plates, And Chips, Mushroom Benidict, Chicken Tikka Masala, Cauliflower Curry, Fish, Burger, Chicken Burger

Review Text:
When they say "you get what you pay for" it's not always a good thing - and in this case even so, as you get more than you would expect for your money. The drinks selection is vast & inexpensive, the food is decent and very good value for money, combine the two (if you can find your ideal meal that includes a drink) and you're talking incredible value - Steak dinner with a large premium IPA for a tenner? That'll do.

Bolton town centre's own Wetherspoons is nicely located, usually aptly staffed and the service is quick & pleasant. I can usually find a seat to dine peacefully uninterrupted on both weekend and weekday visits. The staff are attentive and considerate.

On the constructive side, the recently added outdoor area round the back is pretty pointless as it is far from a sun tap, and even as a non smoker I don't understand why it's there if you can't smoke there (yes I understand the legislation & definition of suitable smoking areas). Also the table arrangement of the main bar/drinking/dining area is a bit erratic, the tables seem cramped in places & randomly positioned.

Another thing for those looking to enhance their Wetherspoons experience; get the app. I know not all Wetherspoons have the fast service Bolton offers (Westhoughton was beyond painful) but it's easy to use, order, modify your preferences and is by far easier than trying to remember your family meal order at the bar.
Recommended Dishes: Fish and Chips, Traditional Breakfast, Pizza, Six Onion Rings

Review Text: Never had an issue with this Wetherspoons. Brilliant and delicious food and drinks. Plenty of seating. Lovely outdoor area with heaters and lights. Toilets are usually quite clean. Plenty of staff around and food and drink come very very quickly. Love it!
Recommended Dishes: Fish and Chips, Traditional Breakfast, Pizza, Caramel Cookie Dough, 3 Small Plates, And Chips, Chicken Tikka Masala

Review Text: Excellent real ale selection. When visited had at least three Peerless ales... they really were peerless! Bar staff very friendly and helpful.
We visited here for my neices graduation had a great time staff were very polite and cheerful will be calling again
Recommended Dishes: Fish and Chips, Traditional Breakfast, Pizza, Six Onion Rings, And Chips

Review Text: First trip to Bolton in 47 years and thus first pint. A really lovely pint from Coach House Brewery. Coachman's Spring Ale. Really refreshing. Excellent choice of ales. Boss having their blueberry beer which is exceptional. Nice building and lovely staff. Only Spoons snobs would complain.

Having been in exile in Spain for over 12 months the main thing we missed was Weatherspoons, its nice to be back and food, drink and prices are very much the same as before we went to Spain. The Spinning Mule has recently been refurbished and is looking very good, thankfully they have got rid of those depressing black & white pictures which did nothing for the atmosphere.
Were do they get the staff, they are totally amazing, so polite and helpful, give the staff 5 stars.

It's a 'Spoons - like pretty much every other 'Spoons. Acceptable, cheap food, quick service (quicker on the mobile app), a good selection of reasonable prices ales. Nothing overly special but can't conplain about cheap beer.

What a birthday treat to be taken out by a superb friend for my birthday tea.

The food was fabulous and the surroundings were also and the atmosphere was also terrific also.

This was the best birthday I have had in my entire life of 50+ years
Food is wonderful and very fast, and if you use the app, it's even faster. It's always a great night when we go in
I had a lovey chicken and Chipotle wrap.other half had a ham and cheese pennini. Great value and  very tasty. Very satisfied.
Good simple food, quick service, never ending coffee n tea, warm and relaxing early morning.

Used the Spinning Mule for breakfast on 2 occasions. The menu was very varied and my daughter and I settled on porridge and fruit plus copious coffee. All very good but strange to be breakfasting at 0830 with folks on adjacent tables drinking pints of bear. It takes all kinds....
Great place for a quick meal and cheap drinks. Decent value for the money.

I don't know how to express my praises for the staff at The Spinning Mule. My elderly dad collapsed whilst he was out with my daughter in Wetherspoons, Bolton. The manager, Sebastian and two female colleagues, went ABOVE AND BEYOND to help. I arrived to meet my daughter and dad before the ambulance turned up. I was so upset but the manager and staff were so caring. Forever in their debt, many thanks to them all. Also, they really enjoyed the food and real ales. The food here is excellent.

Great pub had various beers on offer with very good prices. Food was quick and hot when it arrived. Very enjoyable meal for a great price . The pub was very clean and tidy and the staff were very friendly and helpful üëç üòÄ ‚Ä¶

Just wanted to share our experience. We had a meal last week which was for 9 people. Ordered our food to the same table but 3 different orders. Our food arrived all together (impressed) and all steaks were cooked to perfection (double impressed). Thankyou to the kitchen staff you were amazing xxx

Love this spoons! We visit quite regularly.. The food is always good, the staff are always lovely and service is quick and easy. Toilets are always clean and it's always easy to get a table. Highly reccommend

My spirit is one with nature, from the deepest sand beneath the oceans through to the furthest forest my soul flows. Even though I am one with nature I have no roots. I am a traveller. Always have been. The winds guide me, pulling me ever towards the horizon. Following the brightest star, searching for a new sunrise.

Until I grew weary...

I fell upon the stone steps of the Spinning Mule. Weak and broken, I had all but given up. Until I heard a warm voice, the voice of an Irishman. Dave. He taught me the ways of 3 small plates for ¬£10.95. I can never repay him.

Next, a raven haired queen, Helen. With all knowledge of the contents of 2 for only ¬£10 pitchers, I drifted into the abyss of her warmth. For who wouldn't?.

Third, a prince among men, Dan. A man whose bartending intellect and skill could put even the most experienced bartender to shame. He resides in the kitchen displaying his culinary expertise. His greatest skills stay dormant, as he remains humble, yet powerful.

The fourth, perhaps the darkest of the four. His skills lay not within the realm of physical, tangible things. It lay within his devilish charm, his way with words, his debonair style and finesse. A wink, a smile a few sharp words from him and you were his. His name? A name that echoes in my head, and I hope will remain. Seb.

The other staff were lovely too, food was made in good time, tables could have been wiped more though.

Thanks,
Zac

Review Text:
Not too busy inside, but busy enough at the bar with only 2 serving.
I had a ham and mushroom pizza with a Ghost Ship for ¬£9.03. Nice bit of rocket leaves on top (see photos)
Ps. Please bring a spicy sauce
The day I went, the service was slow, but it was busy. Food was on point. Drinks are awesome, All wetherspoons deserve high rating. Usually, well ran and well priced

Decent place to go with cheap drinks and food which is pretty good for the money. It's a bit dark and dated inside but there is plenty of seating and gives a warm and relaxed atmosphere. Best thing about this place is the different food nights for example on Tuesdays it's steak night, Thursdays curry night and Friday fish etc. For a meal and a drink on these nights it's usually about ¬£6-7 and you really can't go wrong. Other good thing is refillable hot drinks so you can have as many as you like for the price of one. Also by downloading the Wetherspoon's app you can order from your table and pay for it through your phone which is great. Overall quite nice for the price but could do with a lick of paint.
Staff were very efficient. Best I've seen but don't have pizza. Not good
Had the empire burger which was the managers special complete with onion rings and chips. Great value! 2√óempire burgers and 2 pints for ¬£12.40 # winning!

Food and service spot on. Really quick and friendly staff.
Seating area that's underneath the toilet upstairs have unpleasant smell

If you've ever been to a spoons before, you'll know what to expect. Pretty standard with a 3 mile trek to the toilets (given they largely cater to old bitter drinkers, I'm amazed they don't get more stair based fatalities). It was refurbished not long ago, although I can't tell what they did. Staff seemed polite. Service was quick. Food was largely decent, the beans were a little odd. Prices aren't quite as good as they were. The haggis was passable, the black pudding a bit over done, toast was cold but the rest was tasty and warm.
Decent Wetherspoons pub, often busy. Nice staff, just not great if you are looking for food.
Usual busy Spoons offering with choice of well kept real ales and food. Efficient service. Toilets up a longish staircase.
Good location. Amazing atmosphere. Ample of options and good prices.

Typical Wetherspoons, looking out over a greened square. Excellent selection of real ales. Three of us ordered fish and chips (pretty good) and one the beef Madras, described as better than ever.  Plenty of room,  swift polite service.
Really good friendly service and they had fish n chips which was good well done
Standard 'Spoons' food. Well cooked and presented.

Went for mid afternoon lunch, food was as expected and arrived within reasonable time frame and hot. Service was friendly and explained bout the condiments setup. Plenty of tables available and they were clean. Quite steep trek up to the toilets but again they where nice and clean.
It's quite dark and dated pub and clientele bit rough and ready with flowery language but very friendly.

Overall, not bad.

2nd visit here and as it was Saturday evening  it was quite busy but tables were cleared and cleaned regularly and only stopped for a quick drink as I had to keep to a timetable
Shame the toilets are upstairs alot way to walk even though they have 1 disabled toilet downstairs

The prices are worth a visit alone. Absolutely loved the small plate options and the pizzas are some of the best I've had for the price. Staff are really friendly and the table service was fast. Its lost a star because it could do with a face lift but was still clean
Great service. Had the mushroom benidict and it was lovely

Fast service, great prices and great quality. Would go back there. Got the BBQ chicken burger, chips and onion rings with a drink and came to less than ¬£7. Can‚Äôt complain for that price for all of that food.

We stopped going here for a while because the quality of the food went severely downhill. However, we went tonight after not going for a few months and everything was great.
The best thing about this place is that they always have at least one cask stout or porter on. If you're lucky, they'll have two.

Even if the politics of the owner are questionable, at ¬£2.15 a pint of cask, you can't complain.

Absolutely god awful food. Ordered nachos, garlic bread and empire state burger. I always order this same burger whichever wether spoons I go to because it's usually fantastic and value for money. This burger was terrible, dry over cooked yet somehow cold as the cheese wouldn't melt and the dry bun fell apart. The garlic bread came without any garlic butter on and was very dry. The nachos came cold and without cheese, when we sent them back they were gone 10 minutes and came back with a small (and I mean small)sprinkling of grated cheese melted onto the nachos so much it was rock hard. At this point we got up and just left! Won't be going back to a wether spoons for a long time. Think it's the worst meal I've had out in my life.

On visit today 1st February 2019 my husband, myself and grandaughter came for lunch. Myself and husband ordered the Friday fish and chips my husbands was edible (just) my fish didn't  exist it was just a battered fish skeleton there was no fish whatsoever, thought the chips  and mushy peas were ok until I noticed a large hair in the peas, I reported it to the waiting on staff who said he would go and put my complaint forward to the manager. 15 minutes later no one had even came to say sorry and the staff had somehow disappeared, I need an explanation for this as I am utterly angry and disappointed and left hungry. Will someone please take some responsibility and reply to this complaint. ( We do us other Weatherspoons fairly often) waiting for reply.

The cast beer is consistently flat staff lack training in this art ... tables are always piled high with plates full of left over food from the last disappointed customers. .. what a shame this place has ended up in such a state .... come on Weatherspoons you can do better. ...Jeff.....

Just been to the spinning mule tonight for some food and my experience was awful!! The staff have no customer service what so ever my partner asked where our food was as we'd waited over an hour and the waiter said "I don't know I'm not psychic!" I just felt like this was no way to speak to a paying customer!! And when I told the manager about how he spoke to us she tried to accuse us of laughing at him and "bullying" him! I am no bully and felt this was the wrong way to handle the situation, then we were kicked out the pub saying "we're not welcome!" I am disgusted by the way I have been treated tonight never stepping foot in this pub again!

Went in today with a view to ordering lunch, sat down looked at the menu, decided what we wanted to eat all fine, went to the bar to order food, there was 3 members of staff on, one women was stood at the end of the bar asking 2 male staff if they was a cocktail what would they be??? All whilst i am waiting to order, the 2 young men behind the bar, one was serving customers the other clearly saw us stood there as did the women, the young male, glasses curly hair, blatantly walked past 3 times without even acknowledging us, he was collecting glasses from the pub (this could have been done after our order was taken as we was the only ones in the que) the women then also picked up a tray and again clearly walked straight pasted us into the kitchen, the 2nd male who was serving customers at the time shouted over to the other male for him to jump on the till, at this point his reply was very loud and across the pub "NO" all whilst we are still stood  trying to order food, its safe to say at this point we walked out... and will not be returning... as a person who works in hospitality this is totally unacceptable and would take a look at the customer service provided....

Yes the tables were sticky and unclean but the staff were friendly and I checked first that they were happy for me to use the app to order.

My drink arrived nice and quick and the food arrived within twenty minutes. After asking, I even got the table cleaned before it arrived.

The food was OK.  Certainly not the best Wetherspoon I've been to but not the worst either (better than Whitstable).  The usual good value menu and the usual noisy crowd that were already drunk 5pm.
Food cold American breakfast service very quick and friendly
It's okay for reasonably priced food and a drink. I just think they have put too many tables in! Just no space at all in between especially up on the upper bit near the window

It's a pub in the centre of Bolton serving real ale and a selection of food in relaxed surroundings. My only gripe is the time it took to clear the tables and the attention to hygiene wiping tables and sticky menus.

I understand The Spinning Mule is due for a revamp, and this will be happening soon. It's more than ready for a make over. Food ordering is straightforward but often arrives cold and sending it back is a nightmare.  I always thought that a returned meal would be dealt with straight away but no you go to the back of the queue so if your in company they end up eating alone and by the time you get your meal you don't want it. The staff work hard on the whole but could do with extra help at busy times.

Usual Wetherspoons set up, and yes, the toilets are upstairs.

Was untidy when I went and empty bowls and no vinegar on the table where the condiments were. Food arrived pretty quickly but wasn't the warmest food I have ever had.
cheap and cheerful. fast service though i must admit

Good food at good prices, decoration and cleanliness is lacking severely if I'm honest.
Toilets like an ice rink due to grease build up and furnishings being torn and left to hang around.

Had a burger and chips, just something simple. Burger ok, but the chips tasted awful. Like they had cooked them in old fish frying oil. Tasted fish in every bite. Left them in the end. Who the hell cooks chips in a fish fryer? Good choice of beers though.

Reasonably priced food and drink.Hand sanitizer at entrance and near toilets,screens between some tables,face masks optional(not encourage),no social distancing.No outside area,smokers outside entrance.Did not feel comfortable due to having underlying medical conditions.Delta variant not going away yet, but majority of customers seem to be unconcerned so visiting is all down to personal  choice.
Decent cheap food always very nice , not the cleanest of places but that could be down to limited staff. Always worth a visit I say

Prices are okay and food is alright, but wasn't impressed about waiting almost an hour for a turkey and stuffing barm with chips? There was barely anyone in there either so it isn't like they were mega busy.

This is a pleasant jds which generally has a good atmosphere. It is smaller than most other jds I have been in and can get quite packed at weekend. It is in need of refurbishment as it feels tired and tatty and a bit dim. Tends not to have enough staff on at busy times.

Wouldv'e been better if we weren't limited to a 3 hour max stay. I know it's not your fault but rationing isnt the answer. How about once youv'e had your Jenrick substantial meal you vacate the table & move to a seperate area if you wish to continue drinking. Just keep your receipt to prove you had a meal?

As a person who has been in the premises on a one off occasion I have been blown away by the experience as I was treated as a piece of paper by staff, I purchased alcohol three times and I was blown away by the experience as I was gutted to have been short changed on two times by one of the most ill trained people I have ever come across.
In close to fourty years of life.
Not a place to be rushing back to for a drink.
Your typical chain owned pub and eatery. Polite staff and reasonable food, although one of the desserts took 30 minutes to arrive and quite clearly been microwaved as it had hot and cold spots.
Big spacious pub but needs a re-vamp. Chep nd cheerful, very busy weekend. Serve food till late.
Foods ok sometimes and the beers great to an excellent place and good value for money. Ok for families and kids.
Myself and my other half went in on Saturday for some lunch which we couldn't eat because it was dry and cold
Staff have no knowledge of the real ales that are currently on tap.  Asked for a lager type beer meaning not s bitter and was told no lager only real ale.  I'm not that stupid
Standard wetherspoons, you know what your getting, cold decent beer and cheap and cheerful grub.
Sausages were minging, and I could smell the trans fats on the black pudding üò¨ The rest of it was ok though, and the staff are nice. ‚Ä¶
Good for meal deals,drinks,lunch. Let down by staffing. But the staff they have are great,but over worked.

Been to one spoons you've been to them all, nothing is excellent, but nothing is bad either, staff as always working hard due to this being quite a busy pub, but they're always happy to help if you need anything.

It is typical large group owned pub just the same as ever other one in the group beer is kept well you find the people make it a good or not so good place
Food again is what you would expect for the price
Bad dry food but nice beer. Pizza undercooked
We had the burgers, which were nice, would have been better if he cheese had been melted and the bacon was crispy.
It's a spoons so the food is perfectly fine.  Decent choice of cask ales but the quality aint the best. Untappd average 2.8
Food was OK, wait times weren't the best
Not a bad place, I was there in the day so it was fairly nice and quiet, and it's clean not like some Bolton pubs where it's like your walking on spit and sawdust lol

Love this spoons the real ale is always top notch but today we had breakfast and it was awful!The egg was like jelly undercooked and everything else was stone cold!We have breakfast in spoons all over the country and yes its usually a bit lukewarm but today's was stone cold!Why can you not do something about this when so many people complain about it!
Food  a lot of  time  is  cold   and  disabled  toilets  broken  door to get  in
Typical weatherspoons million mile walk to loo but great food and beer at a great place
Cheep and Chearful food, worth a visit if you are hungry and on a budget, would recommend the buffalo spicy wings and pizza
Food ok, but need too keep drinkers out of eating area,  it was hard too find a table and some pensioners had too sit down on the tall tables with boozed up drinkers .üòéüåûüá¨üáß ‚Ä¶
Food was ok but the whole eating area didnt look clean, staff was nice thoe
Basically what you'd expect from a Weatherspoons. Sticky carpets and morning drinkers.
It's an oreet wetherspoons, my Dad used drink here, so we came here for a couple of jars after the funeral.
Standard Wetherspoons and it's usual crowd during the daytime. It's saving grace is a brilliant selection of ales and ciders, all of which are cheap as chips.
It's a wetherspoons. It's like every other wetherspoons. It's cheap, it's got food, it has some unbalanced vibes. Classic wetherspoons.
Could do with a clean and tidy up, not up to most of Tim Martin's Weatherspoons pubs
Ordered a burger. Chips and onion rings were nice but burger was a bit dry
Been going in here for over 15 years and a fan of Wetherspoons round country and not sure why the Bolton one hasn't had a refurd  yet very disappointing
Lovely bar staff, very pleasant, food a little bland
The food could of been hotter, the tables were unclean sticky... not the best but also not the worst...
Decent range of drinks, a bit dark inside. Reasonable food
Looks better in daylight, needs brightening up...
Average Spoons pub. In need of a makeover which is long overdue. Seems to be always understaffed at the bar!
Good beer. Needs more staff. They are run off their feet.
Staff are brilliant but the pub is dirty in general
It's about time they did up the pub.  Just seemed unkempt.
Cheap pints and now nice since its been refurbished x
Good food but think some  of it is microwaved or reheated
Had to ask to find this place. A bit small and cramped for a Wetherspoons but ok. More of a drinkers pub than food pub
Social distance measures where in place however smokers where smoking by the door which filled the pub up with strong smellimg smoke
My egg didn't have a runny yoke and child just done
Staff not very efficient although manager was very pleasent
Bit dark , no atmosphere, nice staff.

Rude and miserable staff in need if a coat if paint
Food always seems cold
As every other spoons place good cheap food
It's okay. Went for breakfast.. service was okay but they forgot half my breakfast and had to go back to get it. When it was eventually a full plate it was okay to be fair
Nice old place to chat and eat reasonably priced food
Breakfasts are top rate in fact very good  & tasty
Ok typical weatherspoons good food good value
Standard, some things don't need changing
Great pub good pint plenty beer to choose from
Could do with a refit after 24 years looking a bit tatty.
Spoons.. it's ok.. Great hot drink refill but breakfast is expensive for What you get..
Food ok toilets not good disabled ones are very smelly
Good meeting place but thats about it too quiet for me
The glasses are always unclean but there's a great atmosphere
Meal was okay, service was good.
Typhical spoons. Not the biggest and the loos aren't great but the staff were friendly and as always the drink were cheap
Fairly average prices for fairly average quality food and drinks.
Food was terrible but prices for the beer is good
It's a weatherspoons , you get what you get
Very obviously in need of a refit, carpet and furniture quite " tired". Jim
Went for breakfast wasn't as good as other Wetherspoons I've been to.
Toilets to far away being all the way up stairs, decent cheap food,
Food has improved,  maybe a new cook.
Had breakfast was ok but nutting to write home about,
Needs a facelift and tables cleaned and stop people smoking at door
Big place but not much seating area
Typical wetherspoons but really friendly staff
Absolutely is a spoons. Could not be any more average.
Food and service could be better
Best prices in Bolton anywhere in England for that matter
very poor food served cold on two occasions
Ok food you get what you pay for!
Everything you can expect from a Witherspoon's.
Standard Wetherspoons. No better or worse than others
Full of old men and no atmosphere
It's Weatherspoons it does what it says on the tin
Waited a long time for food
Its wetherspoons. It's what it says on the can.
It's a wetherspoons! Know what to expect
Another let down by the Wetherspoons app

Recommended Dishes: Six Onion Rings, Caramel Cookie Dough, And Chips, Burger

Review Text: The last meal we had 2 pieces of chicken had black meat inside but we have had many meals here with no problems so didn't complain and the food and drink are so well priced we will return again soon

Food served to you in no time
Staff pleasant and polite
Good food and arrived quickly, great value too.

Ticked another Wetherspoon off the list and this is one of the smaller venues I‚Äôve visited but also proved that size doesn‚Äôt matter as I enjoyed my visit. The staff were friendly and the atmosphere was good.

Most staff in there really friendly, service can be slow sometimes depending on whos on the bar but if you go to a spoons and expect fast service - you're in the wrong place. When the service is slow staff always super apologetic. Food always decent, drinks are good prices. Dont get tequila here though, they never bring you the lime and salt even if you ask for it.
Big pub good Guinness normal town centre spoons
Nice pub good selection of beers and lagers nice staff.
Arrived and was very busy ! Despite that service was quick and food was hot and very nice ! Enjoyed and thank you

Great for a drink but unfortunately the food is not great, although you pay little expect little. My scallops were little, but not tasty at all.. I'll still drink there for the meet up and  first paint.
Weatherspoons pub had breakfast hear had the traditional breakfast my wife had the gluten free breakfast  no ash browns  but had mushrooms  Good food. Good service friendly staff. and warm.

Recommended Dishes: Fish and Chips, Traditional Breakfast, Pizza, Six Onion Rings, Chicken Tikka Masala, Fish, Burger

Review Text: Worst wspoons in coutry.staff very ignoreant. Been in over 60 spoons never return hear.and i live in Bolton.
